definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: I tore up the note, got in the car and started driving.
sentences.chinese: 我撕毀遺書，坐到車裏，發動引擎。

sentences.english: She left a suicide note let shu ping sedan must go, never back to the high house.
sentences.chinese: 她留下遺書讓淑萍花轎來了一定要走，永不再回邱家。

sentences.english: Police did not divulge the note's contents, and gave no reason why Schnor took his own life.
sentences.chinese: 警方並未公佈遺書內容及施諾爾自殺原因。

sentences.english: She left a letter of me, a sort of will.
sentences.chinese: 她給我留下一封信，也算是遺書吧。

sentences.english: Police also didn't find a suicide note, he added.
sentences.chinese: 他補充說，警方也沒有發現遺書。

sentences.english: Dunhuang books later recovered from places like temples of local gods are material proof of the aforesaid view.
sentences.chinese: 土地廟等後出郭煌遺書是上述觀點的實物例證。

definition: words of the deceased/last words of the dying/wisdom of past sages
to find/to track down/to recover (sth lost)
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
elder brother/term of respect for a man of about the same age
to confirm (sth to be true)/to verify
